ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I gained a vast overview and understanding of the main concepts of molecular biology like DNA Replication and Repair, Transcription, and Translation. I also gained an understanding of RNA processing, RNA splicing, and RNA structure.
I learned about the central dogma of biology and the main mechanisms of DNA, RNA, etc.
I learned a lot of foundational molecular biology knowledge, history, and certain foundational experiments in molecular biology.
Understanding of molecular mechanisms of replication, transcription, and translation. Molecular technologies and how they've changed research and development of treatments.
I learned a lot about DNA and RNA, the central dogma, and biotechnology.
Thorough exploration of transcription and translation. Lots of cool applications in genome technology. I also finally understand how CRISPR works.
Good
I learned about the biochemical processes of microorganisms and the ways in which we can manipulate this biology for human health.
Fundamentals for Mol bio
molecular biology
Understand the basic molecular biology

A lot of meat and potatoes material for prospective molecular researchers!  No fluff, and I appreciate that.  I now have a solid, basic understanding of the molecular mechanisms that influence gene expression.
This course definitely gave me a good foundational understanding of molecular biology and taught me a lot about how it can be applied to different scientific fields.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: Amazing course material selection and the professors are good at teaching the material. Also, Dr. Pyle hosting "Molecular Biology Lunch" with Dieter Soll (genetic code) and Joan Steitz (splicing + everything) was fantastic for bringing engagement to the course. The weekly journal readings and associated study guides were great for learning more specifics about molecular biology. The selection of research papers is also fantastic.

Weaknesses: I think the course doesn't focus enough on critical thinking in molecular biology. I think there could be additional focus on the experiments that led to the discoveries we learn about. I think that this could just make the class more interesting.

Strengths: Dr. Pyle is an incredible professor. She clearly cares about students. Dr. Isaacs also was a great lecturer. I really liked the material we learned, but at times it felt like the lectures went over-time and included information that was not super relevant/necessary given the scope of this class. I would have appreciated if that material had been cut out and we focused mainly on the concepts with examples to illustrate them. Weaknesses: The TAs were great, but the ability they could help us was limited due to their not having a great understanding of what the professors believed was most important for us to know. I would have appreciated more communication between the Professors and TAs so that the TAs would be able to help us better understand what to prioritize when studying.

The strength of this class is that it is a relatively low workload, pretty comparable to the bio sequence. Aside from weeks of an exam, there are no problem sets, just reading responses for papers, they usually took 2-3 hours per week. The weaknesses in this class are the exams. 3 exams that are worth 25%, and each exam is 10 pages long. Don't expect to finish them early either: it's either you know a majority/all of the content on the exam and you are writing for 75 minutes straight or you leave problems blank-- no in between.

Both professors are knowledgeable and teach well. The section papers correspond with what was taught in lecture. 
Weakness is just how much information they expect you to absorb from lecture, would appreciate some form of outline on the important pieces they really want you to learn versus the things they tell you about purely from a point of interest.

Strength: a lot of content about molecular biology; involves contemporary research. Pyle is a great instructor. Weaknesses: Isaacs does not care about teaching; he walks into the classroom at 9 am having yet to edit all his slides.

Strengths: fascinating material that all builds on each other, interesting papers discussed in section that improved my understanding of course material

weaknesses: exams at times seemed more focused on testing our speed than our actual understanding of the material.
Good

Strength: discussion sections that helped supplement the lecture
Weaknesses: no access to recorded lectures

Strengths: exams were actually pretty straightforward and the class was very organized. Weakness: it was very difficult to tell what the exam was actually going to test on and you were expected to memorize A LOT. I think it would have been beneficial to offer homework and study guides that allowed us to practice the material.
too much paper to read

The workload for this class is very manageable, however in order to pass, you must take the initiative and study a little at least every day. Each lesson is packed with a lot of information, so it is not sustainable to only study before the tests.

Strengths: Excellent teachers, patient at answering questions, and readily available to help.  Also, the discussion sections are very interactive.

Weaknesses: Some of the tests are hyper-specific to the material, and a lot of questions were just "you know it or you don't."  I think the tests could use more critical thinking, longer problems.
I think the exams should cover broader concepts instead of hyperspecific "gotcha" questions.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes!
Yes, you likely have to take it for a requirement

Yes I would. If you have any interest in pursuing a career in anything molecular biology related this class is very good in teaching you the foundational knowledge in Molecular Biology. If you are on top of studying, the exams won't pose too much of an issue (they are curved; with a 65% average on each test) and there are no problem sets, just reading a paper every week.
Yes, lots of good information you will need to know for a scientific career
Yes, if you'd really like to learn about molecular biology. The content is solid, but the first half will be a struggle because of the instructor.
Yes, especially if you like going into a lot of detail about biology.
No
Take if you are really dedicated to learning more about molecular biology. This is not an easy class and requires a lot of effort to keep up but is rewarding if you enjoy the subject.
If you want to refresh mol bio, it would be great for you to take it
yes, if they want some introduction course
Yes, very helpful to get a basic understanding of molecular bio
Yes, both of the professors are extremely knowledgeable, and are great lecturers. They are engaging and really know what they are talking about.
Yes.  If you're looking to do bio research, highly recommend.
I would!  I think this is a great course for any MCDB major.
